channel.title: Samdape

item.title: Look Within: The Key to Problem Solving

item.title: Redefining the Concept of Prompts in Communication
item.description:
you don’t call it prompting trying to convey an idea to a person

— sam (@samdape) January 10, 2025

item.title: The Impact of Algorithms on Art Exploration
item.description:
on the internet, we don’t go to museums

we let the algorithm push new art into our faces for 24 hours, and then it’s basically gone

when was the last time you actively searched for a specific piece of art or artist just to look at the work for a while?

— sam (@samdape) January 11, 2025

& we're live https://t.co/EVDgSNyZer

— sam (@samdape) January 15, 2025

item.title: "Transforming Site to iOS App: Exciting Updates and Pricing Changes"
item.description:
one year

super fun couple of days turning my @v0 site into a native iOS app w @alec_dilanchian

he'll have a thread about the process later

also turns out my pricing strat was (too) silly, so we changed it to a flat one

enjoy 🌻

ps. also works on mac https://t.co/opUstmyetf pic.twitter.com/jQau8zEmAV

— sam (@samdape) January 15, 2025

item.title: "Unexpected Motivation to Master Tie-Tying Skills"
item.description:
the sudden urge to learn how to tie a tie in case it comes up

item.title: Web App Transformed to iPhone App in 72 Hours!
item.description:
In the last 72 hours, @samdape and I converted a web app made on @v0 to a native iPhone app that you can download rn in the App Store.

And, I only wrote 10% of the code lol.

Here's how I did it + some prompts to help you do the same 🧵 pic.twitter.com/H0EKq0gaXS

— alec (@alec_dilanchian) January 16, 2025

item.title: "Exciting Transition: @read_cv Joins @perplexity_ai Team"
item.description:
Today I’m excited to share that @read_cv is joining the team at @perplexity_ai in their mission to make the world's knowledge more accessible to everyone. This is incredibly bittersweet for us, as the start of this new chapter will mark the end of our time with @read_cv.

It has… pic.twitter.com/6CUinOEGsi

— andy chung (@_andychung) January 17, 2025

item.title: Digitizing Cards and Letters: A New Concept by Sam
item.description:
keep your cards & letters 📬

I always feel bad about tossing cards into a drawer, so I created this concept to quickly digitize the cards and letters I want to keep with me.

made w @figma pic.twitter.com/aZU4COB9t7

— sam (@samdape) January 5, 2025

item.title: Passion for Design and Truth in Creativity
item.description:
I love good design and art—it’s what I try to do every day, and it’s what I think about most of the time. It gives life more meaning and makes us feel connected, and I will never stop trying to make beautiful things.

But what I love even more is truth, and if a product is super… https://t.co/qurRmkO3t2

— sam (@samdape) January 3, 2025

item.title: Go Grayscale: Design Focus Over Color
item.description:

ps. if your figma designs don’t look good in b&w, adding colors won’t fix that, but they can make good design even better pic.twitter.com/lzJ29pzWbq

— sam (@samdape) December 28, 2024

item.title: "Cursor AI: Magic with Xcode, but UI Needs Simplification"
item.description:

but the current code editor UI is still too intimidating for 99% of people who know nothing about code (me)

just show me an app preview + chat window

— sam (@samdape) October 30, 2024

item.title: Personalized One-Image-a-Day Diary Journey
item.description:
🌵🪐one📷🧃day🗿🍄

something that makes it easy to look back, feels fun, and adds little (time) pressure keep this little habit going
